title: Let's Hang
description: Let's Hang, or Hangman is a classic word guessing game in which you must guess as many hidden words as you can before you run out of tries! Originaly the game was created as a project #1 for GA WDI program, had low functionality and lots of bugs. Hours of studying and few months after the game was re-written from scratch and now can impress with the full functionality, attractive design and clean code. The game is based on simple JavaScript logic with the use of words-API for dictionary purposes. Basic SVG animation.
stack: HTML | CSS | JavaScript | SVG | Animation | API

title: Pig Game
description: Pig Game is a simple jeopardy dice game, where the dominant type of decision is whether or not to jeopardize previous gains by rolling for potential greater gains. The object is to be the first to meet or exceed a goal score. The game was created as project for Complete Java Script Course and was a complete success from the very beginning. I had an opportunity to thoroughly discover and enjoy the simplicity of JavaScript while working on the logic of the game, and play with CSS while following the simple required disigne.

title: Fridgify
description: Welcome to Fridgify, an online refrigerator where you can inventory what's in your actual fridge. Have you ever been at a party and wanted to know if you had Kraft singles in your fridge to make grilled cheese when you get home? Well now you will! With Fridgify, you'll have a visual fridge interface to add the name, quantity, expiration date of anything in your fridge, and categorize them by food group and fridge or freezer. You'll never forget where you left that slice of ham again! This project is the product of efforts of two young ambitious web developers: Sathya Ram and me.
stack: React | CSS | JavaScript | Node | Express | Mongoose

title: History Reconsidered
description: History Reconsidered is my biggest project so far. It's a fully functioning history blog. Building this website was my personal challenge and a great learning oportunity, as I chose to build it using Vue.js framework for the first time.

title: Portfolio
description: Have I just included my portfolio in my portfolio? Yes, absolutely, one hundrer percent. Why? Because its code is as valuable as any other application and helps visitors of my website to know me better as a programmer. The website is built with Vue.js framework and fully styled using SASS syntactical language, using mixins and variables. Moreover, structuraly my SASS files form a separate folder system, so if at any point I decide to change framework, i can just lift my styling and build it in in any other application.
